docs.snippet: Norway is set to become the first nation to start switching off its FM radio network next week, in a risky and unpopular leap to digital technology that will be closely watched by other countries considering whether to follow suit....
docs.lead_paragraph: Norway is set to become the first nation to start switching off its FM radio network next week, in a risky and unpopular leap to digital technology that will be closely watched by other countries considering whether to follow suit.

headline.main: Norway to Switch Off FM Radio in Risky, Unpopular Shift to Digital
headline.print_headline: Norway to Switch Off FM Radio in Risky, Unpopular Shift to Digital

docs.snippet: A jury has begun deliberating in the federal death penalty trial of a man convicted of carjacking and killing two Massachusetts men and a third man in New Hampshire during a weeklong crime rampage in 2001....

docs.snippet: A man who climbed through razor wire to escape from a detention center in Rhode Island, stole a car and may have tried to rob two banks was captured in Massachusetts on Thursday by a state police trooper who chased him and grabbed him as he tried ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A man who climbed through razor wire to escape from a detention center in Rhode Island, stole a car and may have tried to rob two banks was captured in Massachusetts on Thursday by a state police trooper who chased him and grabbed him as he tried to leap over a fence, authorities said.

headline.main: Police: Man Who Escaped From Detention Facility Is Captured
headline.print_headline: Police: Man Who Escaped From Detention Facility Is Captured

docs.snippet: Mexico's central bank sold dollars in Mexico and New York on Thursday to fight off the peso's nose dive to record lows amid fears U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's protectionist policies could further hammer Latin America's second-biggest econom...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexico's central bank sold dollars in Mexico and New York on Thursday to fight off the peso's nose dive to record lows amid fears U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's protectionist policies could further hammer Latin America's second-biggest economy.

headline.main: Mexico Central Bank Sells $1 Billion to Prop Peso After Trump Slump: Traders
headline.print_headline: Mexico Central Bank Sells $1 Billion to Prop Peso After Trump Slump: Traders
